body:
Messages like `Review log for details` should include the location - or perhaps just its name - of the log file to be reviewed.

### Rationale

Yes. I am trying to debug the NWChem install failure.  It says to review the log.  Which log?

```
==> Error: Installation of nwchem failed.  Review log for details
```

### Description

I can, of course, search my filesystem for this file, whose name I do not know, but it's not convenient.

For example, I looked for the log like this:
```
$ find /opt/spack/spack/ -name "*nwchem*"
/opt/spack/spack/opt/spack/.spack-db/failures/nwchem-sgdfim2nm2myvi47fyjcpcnb3ct3phwj
/opt/spack/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/nwchem
```
Neither file is a log.

I am not interested in looking through 675 hits for the log I need...
```
$ find /opt/spack/spack/ -name "*log*" | wc -l
675
```

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate

```
$ spack --version
0.14.0-271-1bcc80ec5
```

https://github.com/spack/spack/issues?q=log+location was not particularly useful...
title: please provide log path in error messages
